messageBody:
Mike,

That's a cool runner. It looks like some of the features might be valuable
enhancements to the core runner.

However, I'm not sure if this is what the original poster wanted. What do
you think?

David Saff

On 4/5/07, Mike Norman <michael.norman@...> wrote:
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "cliveborrageiro" <cliveborrageiro@...>
> wrote:
> >
> > Hi,
> >
> > I'm using a Parameterized test and would like to perform a single
> > setup state (like @BeforeClass) for all test methods to use. This
> > setup method needs to use the parameter passed into the constructor.
> >
> > The problem is that @BeforeClass needs to be static and is called
> > before the constructor, there I'm unable to get the parameter for the
> > setup.
> >
> > Any suggestions...
> > Thank you,
> > Clive
> >
>
> I have created a custom JUnit4 Runner:
>
> @RunWith(junit.extensions.pb4.ParameterizedBeforeRunner.class)
>
> Supports an optional parameter to be passed into static @BeforeClass
> methods:
>
> @BeforeClass
> public static void setUpBefore(Properties p) ...
>
> The rules are:
>
> If your test class is in a package com.foo.bar, then in your
> classpath the directory com/foo/bar one can place a standard Java
> .properties file. If your test class is called 'ASimpleTestSuite'
> then the file MUST be called 'asimpletestsuite.properties'
> (all-lower).
>
> The same Properties is passed to any @AfterClass with the
> appropriate method signature. Regular JUnit4 @BeforeClass/@AfterClass
> methods without the Properties argument still work.
>
> Additionally there is a System Property that is a global
> merge/override:
>
> -
> Djunit.extensions.parameterizedB4.properties={path_to}/override.properties
>
> any keys in override.properties will (obviously) override those same
> keys from the testclass' local 'XXX.properties'; otherwise, the
> operation is a merge of the 2 sets of Properties.
>
> I have made this runner work with the suite runner:
>
> @RunWith(ParameterizedBeforeRunner.class)
> @SuiteClasses({
> ASimpleTestSuite.class,
> AnotherSimpleTestSuite.class
> })
>
> Additional changes:
> - added a state machine to standard test listeners so that the
> run report displayed at the end shows ACTUAL passed/ignored/failed
> counts
> - added a '-quiet' flag: does the obvious, causes the run report
> to be suppressed
> - added a '-verbose' flag: shows additional information as to
> exactly WHICH test passed/failed/or was ignored
> - added a '-stopTestsOnFailure': stop all testing upon detecting
> first failure
> - in addition to the design-time @Ignore annotation, added a
> runtime COMPUTED ignore(String, boolean) method
> - an Ant task <ParameterizedBeforeJUnit4> compiled against 1.6.5
> (ToDo - 1.7.0 version)
>
> With respect to licensing, it is likely that it will be released
> under the EPL, perhaps as soon as the end of the month.
>
